title: Lattice Constant Statistical Analysis with 4D-STEM: A Case Study of Point Defects in Cr Under Varied Temperature and Irradiation
content: Nanoscale defects play a pivotal role in determining the mechanical behavior of crystalline metals under various environmental conditions [1]. These defects, which manifest as vacancy-type or interstitial-type atoms or clusters, typically arise under non-equilibrium conditions such as radiation damage, which, in concert with varying temperatures, alters the metal microstructure.
